page.title: 07Housing, Sherborne St. John
page.content: The housing in the village of Sherborne St.John is as varied as that of North Basingstoke in age, type and density. The village contains various cottages built on timber frames and infilled with wattle and daub, brick and stone. There are many cottages built by the Vyne Estate for its workers. These cottages have been modernised but all maintain an identifiable style. There are individual Georgian and Victorian grand houses some of which were old farm houses. There is an estate of council houses built in the 1950's, a council developemnt of old people's bungalows and maisonettes built in the 1970's, and a road of private bungalows. There has been much infilling with modern detached housing. There are also scattered rural premises of many types.
